'''Harnaut''' is a city in [[Nalanda district]] of [[Bihar]], [[India]], and the entrance city of [[Nalanda]]. The [[Hindu]], [[Buddhist]] and [[Jain]] pilgrim centres of [[Nalanda]], [[Pawapuri]], [[Rajgir]], [[Bodh Gaya]] and [[Vaishali (ancient city)|Vaishali]] are all located nearby this city. The incumbent [[Chief Minister of Bihar]], [[Nitish Kumar]], is from Harnaut.
==Geography== [[File:winter Sunset.jpg|thumb|Harnaut evening in spring]]
It is located at an elevation of {{cvt|49|m}} above [[mean sea level]] (MSL).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/34/Harnaut.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=2009-03-27 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081222210746/http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/34/Harnaut.html |archive-date=2008-12-22 |df= }} Map and weather of Harnaut</ref> Harnaut is one of the most prominent block of [[Nalanda district]]. It is the gate city of Nalanda. located 55 km from [[Patna]], the capital of Bihar state, and 23 km from the [[Nalanda|Ruins of Nalanda]]. It is situated on bank of River Panchanan. The land of Harnaut is very fertile. Alluvial soil is mostly deposited by several rivers of this area. There are many local rivers such as Dhoba, Panchanan, etc. Holy river [[Ganges]] passes nearby at a distance of 10 km.
==Climate== [[File:cloudy.jpg|thumb|Weather in rainy season]] Harnaut has a [[Humid subtropical climate]] under the [[Köppen-Geiger climate classification system|Köppen climate classification]]: (Cwa) with extremely hot summers starts from early March to late June, the [[monsoon]] season starts from July to late August and chilly winter nights and foggy or sunny days from November to February. The climate is not much hot in summer. Harnaut summer's highest day temperature is in between 30 °C to 42 °C . Average temperatures of January is 13 °C, February is 19 °C, March is 25 °C, April is 30 °C, May is 32 °C .

==Overview== At present this city does not have municipality, but it is under Sabnahua Panchayat. The people of this city are demanding it to be made into a subdivision. In 2016, the Government of Bihar issued a draft order converting Harnaut into a [[Nagar Panchayat]] combining nine villages - Sabnahua, Rupuspur, Poria, Cheran, Basti, Srichandpur and Dihri.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.urban.bih.nic.in/Letters/LN-01-01-07-2016.pdf|publisher=Urban Housing and Development Department, Government of Bihar|date=1 July 2016|title=Notification|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807001650/http://www.urban.bih.nic.in/Letters/LN-01-01-07-2016.pdf|archive-date=7 August 2016|df=}}</ref>
The incumbent [[chief minister]] of [[Bihar]], Mr. [[Nitish Kumar]], has been elected many times as MLA from Harnaut legislative assembly seat. His native village Kalyan Bigha is 4 km north-west of Haranut. River Muhane passes 1 km west of the city.
The population of city is around 176140{{citation needed|date=July 2016}}. It is divided into many parts: Harnaut Beech Bazar, [[National Highway 30A (India)|NH-30A]] , [[National Highway 31 (India)|NH-31]], Harnaut station-Kalyanbigha Rd and Harnaut-Athmalgola Rd. Administrative offices are in Dakbanglow Road. Dakbanglow Road is linked to High School Harnaut, Middle School Harnaut, many tuition centres, a big playground and guest house. Beech Bazar (Central Market Rd) and Cheran Rd is the commercial area of Harnaut. This city is linked to several small roads like - Sartha Rd, Dehra Rd, Swedah Rd, Dwarka Bigha Rd, Gokulpur Rd etc. A small bus stand and a green grocery is located just beside the [[National Highway 31 (India)|NH-31]]. There is a Carriage Repair Workshop under [[East Central Railway]] at [[National Highway 30A (India)|NH-30A]] for POH of 50 Non-AC coaches per month.
== Economy ==
Agriculture is the main source of income, with rice, wheat, pulses, fruits and vegetables being the main crop.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} There is also one railway coach factory located in Harnaut.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} Agriculture is the primary activity although tourism in nearby places like Nalanda, Rajgir and Pawapuri boosts economy of this town.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} This town supplies agricultural products like cauliflower, potato, mustard seed and other vegetables to neighbouring states.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} Although the economy is mainly based on agricultural products, garments are also manufactured in household industries.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} For the help of farmers, there is [http://www.icar.org.in/en/node/194l Krishi Vigyan Kendra, Harnaut] which provides help to the people of Nalanda district.
== Culture ==
===Festivals=== [[File:Chhat puja Harnaut 2015.jpeg|thumb|200px|Chhath Puja]] [[File:Navratri 2016 Harnaut.jpeg|thumb|200px|Bharat Mata, Maa Kaali, Maa Durga [[Navratri|Navratra]] Puja 2016 Harnaut]] [[File:Harnaut Diwali 2015.jpeg|thumb|200px|Buildings are decorated with festive lights for Dipawali]] * [[Chhath| Chhath Puja]] * [[Vijayadashami]] * [[Holi]] * [[Diwali|Deepawali]] * [[Saraswati Puja]]
=== Religion === {{bar box|title=Religion |titlebar=#ddd|left1=Religion|right1=Percent(%)|float=right|bars={{bar percent|[[Hinduism|Hindu]]|Orange|96.3}}{{bar percent|[[Islam|Muslim]]|Green|1.7}}{{bar percent|[[Christianity|Christian]]|purple|1.5}}{{bar percent|Other|grey|0.5}}}}
The city's population is predominantly [[Hindu]] with minor [[Muslim]] and [[Christians|Christian]] population. [[Jain]]s, [[Sikh]]s and [[Buddhist]]s are also present because of the most important place for the [[Buddhism]] & [[Jainism]] near [[Rajgir]], [[pawapuri]]. For [[Islamic]] religion '''City Mosque''', for [[Christianity|Christian]] '''Loyola Catholic Church''' and for [[Hinduism]] '''Ramjanki Temple''', '''Mahaveer Temple''' and more.
===Cuisine of Harnaut=== * '''Sweets''' [[Desserts|Sweets]] are present in most restaurants as the popularity has increased. Many commercial stores have been established as solely desserts stores. '''[[Balushahi]]''' well prepared in Bihar State most delicious sweet specially in Harnaut. '''[[Ras malai]]''', '''[[Rasgulla]]''', '''[[Gulab jamun]]''', and many more.
* '''Street food''' '''[[Panipuri]]''' "Bhaiya, thoda spicy kam rakhna". '''[[Bhelpuri]]''' A Zesty snack which is a meld of papadis, puffed rice, sev, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, chillies, coriander leaves and chutneys. '''[[Kachori]]''' with '''[[Jalebi]]''', '''[[Litti (cuisine)]]''' , '''[[Samosa]]''', '''[[Chaat]]''', '''[[Chole bhature]]''' delicious street foods of Harnaut.
* '''Indo-china/Non-veg Cuisine''' '''[[Kebab]]''', '''[[Biryani]]''','''[[Indian Omelette]]''', '''Chilli''' Chicken/Prawn/Fish/Mutton/Vegetables/Paneer. '''Garlic''' Egg/Chicken/Prawn/Fish/Mutton/Vegetables/Paneer. '''[[Indian Chinese cuisine|Manchurian]]''', consisting of chicken or vegetables in a spicy sauce. It is entirely a creation of Chinese restaurants. A little resemblance to traditional [[Chinese cuisine]]. '''[[Chow mein]]''' A popular dish combining noodles, vegetables, scrambled egg, ginger and garlic, soy sauce, green chili sauce, red chili sauce and vinegar.
* '''veg Cuisine''' '''[[Paratha]]''', '''[[Aloo gobi]]''', '''[[Baingan bharta]]''', '''[[Naan]]''', '''[[Palak paneer]]''', '''[[Rajma]]''', these are the special cuisine of city. {{see also|Bihari Cuisine}}
==Transport and connectivity== * [[Road network]]: Harnaut is well connected by roads to different cities. [[National Highway 30A (India)|NH 30A]] connects it to [[Varanasi]], [[Patna]] via [[Fatuha]] to [[Sheikhpura district]], [[Barbigha]], [[Barh]], [[Deoghar]] etc. Harnaut thus serves as the gateway of the Nalanda district to central and southern Bihar. Similarly, [[National Highway 31 (India)|NH 31]] connects it to [[Ranchi]] via [[Hazaribagh]], [[Barhi, Hazaribagh|Barhi]], [[Nawada]], and to northeastern India from [[Mokama]], [[Purnia]], [[Kishanganj]] up to [[Guwahati]].
* [[Rail network]]: [[File:Night view of Harnaut station.jpeg|thumb|250px|[[Harnaut railway station]]]] [[Harnaut railway station]] is the main railway station of the city, under [[Danapur railway division|Danapur Division]] of the [[East Central Railway zone]]. Harnaut is connected with the major cities in India like [[New Delhi]], [[Mughalsarai]], [[Lucknow]], [[Asansol]], [[Howrah]] by the [[Howrah-Delhi Main Line]]with daily passenger, express and super fast trains services. Harnaut railway station lies on the [[Bakhtiyarpur-Tilaiya line|Bakhtiyarpur-Gaya main line]]. This is firstly Bakhtiyarpur-Rajgir Line and the line is being further expanded to Natesar to connect with [[Gaya junction]] via [[Tilaiya Junction railway station|Tilaiya junction]].
==See also== * [[Harnaut railway station]] * [[Carriage Repair Workshop, Harnaut]]
